Package org.lapps.annotatedcorpus

Provides scripted access to annotated documents.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AnnotatedCorpus
    The Interface AnnotatedCorpus represents a ranked list of documents with annotations.
    CorpusCachingStrategy
    The Interface CorpusCachingStrategy defines how to cache corpus based on CorpusQuery and ViewOptions.
    CorpusManager
    The Interface CorpusManager manages corpus.
    DocumentStreamReader
    The Interface DocumentStreamReader streams over a list of documents.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AnnotatedDocument
    The Class AnnotatedDocument stores an annotated document.
    ConnectionOptions
    The Class ConnectionOptions specify how to establish a connection to remote corpus.
    CorpusQuery
    The Class CorpusQuery queries over corpus to select matching documents.
    ViewOptions
    The Class ViewOptions specify how to present each document.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    AnnotatedCorpusException
    The Class AnnotatedCorpusException.
    NoSuchCorpusException
    The Class NoSuchCorpusException.

Package org.lapps.annotatedcorpus Description

Provides scripted access to annotated documents. In general, this API includes interfaces for corpus users to query (selecting subset) and stream (presenting different aspect) of an annotated corpus to get desired output.

The AnnotatedCorpus interface represents a ranked list of annotated documents, which can be either initialized from a connection or constructed from a selection query of another corpus. After constructed, the corpus can be streamed by iterator reader or used to fetch ad-hoc specific document.

Specifically, an AnnotatedCorpus can be queried by a CorpusQuery object and return a new AnnotatedCorpus as selected subset of current corpus. The CorpusQuery queries over corpus to select matching documents. Possible queries include: 1) IR query for lucene/indri e.g. "(president AND Obama)"; 2) regular expression matching query e.g. "(president .* Obama)" over text field and/or annotation field; 3) composite query built from several queries e.g. "(query1 OR !query2)".

Given a corpus, user can stream its documents with different format and aspect by specifying a ViewOptions. The Class ViewOptions specify how to present each document. Possible options include: 1) shows document id; 2) shows document span; 3) shows document content; 4) shows annotation; 5) shows annotation span.

The CorpusManager provides a basic facility to connect remote corpus with ConnectionOptions. The Class ConnectionOptions stores server information such as URL, username, and password. It can also designate a CorpusCachingStrategy to provide caching layer between remote corpus and its local connection.

Example Code:

ConnectionOptions connOptions = new ConnectionOptions();
connOptions.setCorpusUrl(ldcServerUrl);
connOptions.setCachingStrategy(mysqlCachingStrategy);
 
//Connects to a remote corpus server
AnnotatedCorpus aRemoteCorpus = CorpusManager.connect(connOptions);
 
//Query remote corpus and return a new corpus object
AnnotatedCorpus hitlistCorpus = aRemoteCorpus.subCorpus(keytermQuery);
 
myViewOptions.setDocumentContentShown();
myViewOptions.setAnnotationShown();
DocumentStreamReader reader = hitlistCorpus.getDocumentStreamReader(myViewOptions);
while(reader.hasNext()){
  AnnotatedDocument doc = reader.next();
  //do something
}
